elements.title: Trilby, or the Fairy of Argyll (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first two English translations of Trilby, or the Fairy of Argyll (title character pictured) were made to piggyback on the success of the mostly unrelated novel Trilby?

elements.title: Monika Buczkowska (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Monika Buczkowska, who made her stage debut as a student in Poznań as Mozart's Susanna, was a soloist in Beethoven's Ninth Symphony at a charity concert for Ukraine at the Alte Oper?

elements.title: was one of the most-awarded films (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Shiva Baby was one of the most-awarded films not to receive an Oscar nomination in 2022?

elements.title: Tin Srbić (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Tin Srbić was the first Croatian to win a gold medal at the World Artistic Gymnastics Championships?

elements.title: WBIG (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the owners of North Carolina radio station WBIG justified shutting it down by noting that the metropolitan area had outgrown its signal?

elements.title: Oon Chiew Seng (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that gynaecologist Oon Chiew Seng, who was diagnosed with dementia in 2013, was the founding chairperson of the first dementia home in Singapore?

elements.title: chestnut-backed buttonquail (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite being described in 1840, the chestnut-backed buttonquail was only confirmed in Queensland in 2020?

elements.title: Sulayman of Mali (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that unlike his famously generous brother Mansa Musa, Mansa Sulayman of Mali was considered a miser?
